events.1780: Maharaja Ranjit Singh, "Lion of Punjab",  was born.
events.1901: War Secretary Brodrick claimed that Boers were killing natives in large numbers. He intended to withdraw troops from India to fight in S. Africa at London.
events.1908: Yeshwantrao Hindurao Ghorpade, former ruler and great industrialist, was born.
events.1909: Gandhiji left England for South Africa and wrote ''Hind Swaraj'' on board S.S. Kildonan Castle.
events.1917: Gajanan Madhav, famous modern Hindi poet, critic and storywriter, was born.
events.1922: Mahadev Sadashivrao Ande, freedom fighter and political leader, was born.
events.1935: Chandra Prakash Gupta, great educationist, was born at Gaini in UP.
events.1945: Australian Services draw first Victory Test against India.
events.1953: Richard Nixon, the US Vice President, arrives in New Delhi.
events.1962: Yezdani Gulam, great researcher, archeologist and art critic, died.
events.1970: Flooding ravages Ganges delta. 200,000  million killed.
events.1991: Supreme Court orders establishment of an all-India judicial service.
events.1992: Dr. Pundalik Dattatrya Gaitonde, Goa freedom fighter, passed away.
events.1993: The Indian hospital and aviation was operational immediately. The Indian contingent formally took charge of the responsibility of the capital city of Mogadishu.
events.1995: The Supreme Court in an unanimous 65-page verdict declares that patients who received deficient services from the medical profession and hospitals were entitled to claim damages under the Consumer Protection Act, 1986.
events.1998: Tendulkar blazes as India wins the Coca Cola Cup at Sharjah beating Zimbabwe in the final.
events.1999: Punjab Police men, Railways women emerged Federation Cup basketball champions in Jalandhar.
